<@U0KPFAZNF>: That seems to fix it, thanks.

```+ protoc --proto_path=/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/comm/testdata/grpc --go_out=plugins=grpc:/opt/gopath/src /opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/comm/testdata/grpc/test.proto
/opt/gopath/src/test.pb.go: Permission deniedMakefile:223: recipe for target 'protos' failed
make: *** [protos] Error 1```
This is the output of `make protos` (preceded by `make clean`). Expected?
<@U0XQ35CDD> something looks busted
I wouldnt expect /opt/gopath/src/test.pb.go
Note that this is the case even if I do `make dist-clean` first.
I am not blocked because I can always run the `protoc` command directly, but I figured I'd bring this to your attention.
ty, pls file JIRA if you dont mind
Please flag <@U112NNFV4> when content on here is good for external v1.0 doc. Hard to keep track of all slack channels, thanks!

<@U0KPFAZNF>: Gari cannot reproduce this on his machine, so I'm guessing it's just the result of an unsuccessful run on my end, and then a case of `make clean` (and `make dist-clean`) not cleaning up everything. I'll do a `vagrant destroy`, and take it from there.
If the issue persists, I'll follow-up with a JIRA issue.

text: <@U37LUBK8R|emir-sk> has joined the channel
<@U3H0CJXND|atom> has joined the channel

<@U11MANG9G>  It was kind of rough.  Seems most of the issues revolved around the hashtable package, and the native compiler setup it needs.  As I fought through the errors, I had to install Python (2.7 version, as the 3.0 version didn't work), then I had to install the Windows 8.1 SDK, but that doesn't include the compiler that was needed, so I had to install Visual Studio 2013 Express edition.  Previously I had set a npm config setting to try and use VS2015, so I had to reset that to be msvs_version=2015, so i had to reset that to 2013.  Whew...  Figuring out what was needed at each step consisted of some luck and a lot of google'n.
oh, btw...  for folks not in the general channel, that's related to installing the hfc package from npm for the SDK-Demo project.

<@U3H0CJXND> - I guess we need to add <https://github.com/felixrieseberg/windows-build-tools>  to the docs for hfc.  This makes it a snap to install the prereqs required on Windows for installing / compiling node packages with native code

attachments.title: felixrieseberg/windows-build-tools
attachments.text: windows-build-tools - :package: Install C++ Build Tools for Windows using npm

text: I believe I installed those as well :slightly_smiling_face:
thanks for reminding me so that I can update my notes. :slightly_smiling_face:
bummer...  Now when I ry to run "node helloblockchain.js" I get the following error:  Error: Cannot find module 'C:\Users\....\...\SDK-Demo\node_modules\grpc\src\node\extension_binary\grpc_node.node'

Gave a shot at updating to grpc@1.0.1 (latest)..  seemed to get further on the 'node helloblockchain.js', but still threw an error:  Enrolled admin sucecssfully
events.js:160
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error
    at ClientDuplexStream._emitStatusIfDone (C:\Users\...\...\SDK-Demo\node_modules\hfc\node_modules\grpc\src\node\src\client.js:189:19)

<@U3H0CJXND> First of all, thanks for this. I haven’t used Windows in quite a while, but I agree, we should collect this and document. Shall we try to summarize these steps together? I can give it a shot and run it by you...
And then we’ll get someone else, who’s completely new to this (that would “the old you”, before going through this ;-))… and see if he/she can simply follow these steps.

<@U11MANG9G>  Sounds good to me, at least once I get it actually running. :slightly_smiling_face: I'm recording my steps, and I'd like to retry the steps on a fresh machine to make sure I've got it right.
Not a problem. We can iterate on it. I’m just trying to use the “momentum”, while you are at it… and capture this.
It’s good feedback. Certainly.
I've set a reminder to circle back around on this next week (after the holiday and all)
OK. If you don’t mind me Copying & Pasting this, I will quickly open a JIRA item….
(Not legally binding :-))
not a problem at all.
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1466>
<@U3H0CJXND>: You can also update there, or continue here. (now, later, when you are back from hols, etc.) Thanks again, and sorry for the “experience” :wink:
Thanks. Will do.
